Posts.Content: Hi Oksana, I had a mastectomy and nose clearance in December (following WLE in Nov) had drains in for nearly 3 weeks. Shortly after I got swelling as you describe - was in A&E twice over Xmas as I then got an infection. The first surgeon who saw me dismissed me saying lymphodeama surely I knew this was a known side effect. Thankfully the second time I was in as now needed IV antibiotics a breast surgeon was on duty took control & drained 85ml from my Seroma. It has puffed a tiny bit since but is slowly going down. Worth getting a formal diagnosis so that it can be dealt with either way. Hope that helps! Good luck. Tzxy xx

Posts.Content: I'm needle phobic - I was at the start of this journey but it got worse post diagnosis with all the bloods and injections etc. The last straw was during my 2nd op when it took the anaesthetist three very painful attempts to get the cannula in by which time I was in tears and I couldn't physically let go of his hand I had to be prised off. I didn't have an easy ride pre-chemo but once they put the port in it was plain sailing for both giving blood and having chemo. Best decision ever! Slightly reluctant to let it go but I do need to book in to have it removed. We are all different so make the right call for you. Wishing you well Tzxy xx

Posts.Title: Shoes

Posts.Content: Hi there, Sorry you are struggling and that those who role it is to help you aren't fulfilling their role. My advise is always have someone with you even if it is a hospital chaperone. It is always easier to defend someone else especially when you are not feeling on par. I didn't change my oncologist but I did change my surgeon. When you go back after a WLE to be told bad news what you don't need is the surgeon to burst into tears and say I'm sorry but I've never had to give anyone this much bad news before. I'm not saying the second operation went without a hitch but I felt in capable hands and reassured throughout.  When it comes to your care, your treatment, the impact on your life you need to be listened to and records accurate. I get you are all complained out so maybe try the GP approach so have someone focus on you rather than you having to fight & complain. Or see another oncologist and then their assessment will supersede what is on your file - focus on the positive which is restoring you. Hope you find the inner strength to resolve this and get the outcome you deserve. Tzxy xx
Posts.Title: Has anyone changed consultant (Oncologist) due to problems with them...

Posts.Content: Baki, Please don't feel guilty you have a right to live your life. Your sons have the right to more time with their mother - I bet if you asked them they'd rather give up all their inheritance for you. I know you don't want to leave your sons with the burden of knowing that they inherited money that could have helped you. Rather than feeling guilty about your brother buying you the drugs accept the gift with gratitude as a token of his love for his sister. If the boot was on the other foot wouldn't you want to do everything you could to prevent a loved one suffering. You did not choose this battle but you can choose to fight it. Saying all that I get where you are coming from and my heart breaks for you. Love yourself you deserve it. Tzxy xx

Posts.Title: First of FEC-T chemo sesssions today, feeling very nauseous despite...

Posts.Content: Hi Violet blue, This is a huge decision and at the end of the day only you will know deep down what is right for you but taking into account as much information as you can (as if your head isn't swimming enough) will hopefully help you reach it. I wasn't ambivalent to my breasts I loved them and always had they were a big part of the pre-C me. So felt very let down by my favourite booby (doesn't pay to have favourites). Because of this my husband and surgeon talked me into a therapeutic mammoplasty - one sided boob job with WLE.  I didn't like it! The results were great cosmetically (people pay good money for this) but it wasn't the same. I may have come around - I only had a fortnight before bombshell.  Needed further surgery and so went for the get rid option (no immediate reconstruction). Possible reconstruction is a decision I've decided to park for a rainy day in the future. Wearing a fake one is no problem at the moment as it is so cold and everything is under several layers but I'm thinking wardrobe for the summer may need some rethinking. Good luck! Tzxy xx
